title: How to Create a Reading Habit That Sticks
description: We all want to read more, but between work, social life, and screens, it's easy to push reading to “someday.” The trick? Make it part of your routine.
body:
We all want to read more, but between work, social life, and screens, it's easy to push reading to “someday.” The trick? Make it part of your routine.

Here's a simple plan:

  1. Start small: Just 5–10 pages a day is enough.
  2. Make it easy: Keep a book where you drink your morning coffee.
  3. Track it: Use a journal or app to log your progress.
“Reading is essential for those who seek to rise above the ordinary.” — Jim Rohn

Once reading becomes automatic, you'll find yourself finishing books without even trying — and expanding your mind in the process.
